context.title: Verifiable Secret Sharing
context.description: Verifiable Secret Sharing is a secret sharing algorithm for sharing a secret. The secret is distributed in a way that every person receives a unique part of the secret. For the reconstruction of the secret are just a few parts necessary. The secret is reconstructed with the Lagrage polynomial. In comparison to Shamir's Secret Sharing it is possible to verify if all the participants provide a correct part of the secret.
